title: Coroner's Office identifies teen killed in Summerville shooting, crash
content:
The Dorchester County Coroner's Office has identified a 16-year-old who died after a shooting and a car crash Wednesday in a Summerville neighborhood.
Alfonza Campbell Jr. of Summerville died at 107 Daffodil St. in the Robynwyn subdivision. Summerville police were called there shortly before 7 p.m. on multiple reports of shots fired.
He was the driver of a car that struck a tree and overturned, according to the Coroner's Office. An autopsy is scheduled, and the cause of death is pending.
No arrests have been made in the case, said Lt. Nick Santanna, a police spokesman. The investigation continues.
Campbell's death is the second homicide in Summerville this year and the 68th in the tri-county area.
Witnesses or anyone else with information is asked to contact the Summerville Police Department at 843-875-1650. Those who wish to remain anonymous can call Crime Stoppers at 843-554-1111.
